metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27619 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
In Python 3 through 3.9.0, the Lib/test/multibytecodec_support.py CJK codectests call eval() on content retrieved via HTTP.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
libpython3.8 - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
python3.8 - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
python3.8-examples - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
python3.8-venv - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.0-5~20.04
libpython3.9 - 3.9.0-5~20.04
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.0-5~20.04
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.0-5~20.04
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9 - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9-examples - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9-full - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9-venv - 3.9.0-5~20.04
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.5-1~20.04.2').
python3.9 package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.0-5~20.04').
